page.title: 12Morwenstow - Festivals
page.content: The annual Patronal Festival is held on St. John's Day, June 24th. Led by a band the children march behind their banner to a Church service where they after contribute. This ends with the processional hymn 'Onward Christian Soldiers'. Then the children have sports at Crosstown, and a tea of sand wiches, cakes and splits with jam and cream is served in the Martyn Room. Evening events include; Adult Sports, Clay Pigeon Shoot and Disco. It is believed that the first Harvest Festival service was held in Morwen- stow Church last century by the Revd. R.S.Hawker. Harvest Thanksgiving services now take place in our Church and Methodist Chapels and all over the world. St Mark's schoolchildren think of the harvest that is provided for the wild animals in their service.
